title: GitHub Personal Access Token Guide
description: Learn how to generate a Personal Access Token (PAT) for accessing private GitHub repositories.

steps.title: Log in to GitHub
steps.description: Go to github.com and log in. Click on your profile icon in the top-right corner.

steps.title: Developer settings
steps.description: Scroll down and click 'Developer settings' at the bottom of the left sidebar.

steps.title: Personal Access Tokens
steps.tip: Classic tokens have better compatibility than fine-grained tokens.

steps.title: Generate Token
steps.description: Click 'Generate new token' button, then select 'Generate new token (classic)'.

steps.title: Set Permissions
steps.tip: We recommend setting the expiration to 90 days or more.

steps.title: Copy Token
steps.description: Copy the generated token and store it securely.
steps.warning: You won't be able to see this token again once you leave this page. Make sure to copy it!
